Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Autopsy \Au"top*sy\, n. [Gr. ?, fr. ? seen by one's self; ? self + ? seen: cf. F. autopsie. See {Optic}, a.] 1. Personal observation or examination; seeing with one's own eyes; ocular view. [1913 Webster]
By autopsy and experiment. --Cudworth. [1913 Webster]
2. (Med.) Dissection of a dead body, for the purpose of ascertaining the cause, seat, or nature of a disease; a post-mortem examination. [1913 Webster]

autopsy n : an examination and dissection of a dead body to determine cause of death or the changes produced by disease [syn: {necropsy}, {postmortem}, {PM}, {postmortem examination}] v : perform an autopsy on a dead body; do a post-mortem
